publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1045 Alex Johnstone: Congratulations to Monikie Primary School-That the Parliament congratulates Monikie Primary School, Angus, on its recent HM Inspectorate of Education report; notes that the report is one of the best ever received by any school in Scotland with 14 of the assessed categories judged to be very good and one good; commends all the staff, pupils and the whole local school community who contribute to making the school so successful, and believes that Monikie Primary School is an excellent example of a rural primary school that provides a first-class education for all its pupils.
S2M-1045 Congratulations to Monikie Primary School (lodged on 15 March 2004) Murdo Fraser*, Mr David Davidson*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Shiona Baird*, Robin Harper*, Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-1045 Congratulations to Monikie Primary School (lodged on 15 March 2004) Frances Curran*, Bill Aitken*
S2M-1045 Congratulations to Monikie Primary School (lodged on 15 March 2004) Rob Gibson*, Dr Jean Turner*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-1045 Alex Johnstone: Congratulations to Monikie Primary School-That the Parliament congratulates Monikie Primary School, Angus, on its recent HM Inspectorate of Education report; notes that the report is one of the best ever received by any school in Scotland with 14 of the assessed categories judged to be very good and one good; commends all the staff, pupils and the whole local school community who contribute to making the school so successful, and believes that Monikie Primary School is an excellent example of a rural primary school that provides a first-class education for all its pupils. Supported by: Murdo Fraser, Mr David Davidson, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Shiona Baird, Robin Harper, Mrs Nanette Milne, Frances Curran, Bill Aitken, Rob Gibson, Dr Jean Turner, Ms Sandra White, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S2M-1045 Congratulations to Monikie Primary School (lodged on 15 March 2004) John Scott*
